data.title: brackets package
data.body:
Make bracket matching (`[{("'`) a package

/cc @probablycorey

data.title: Atom Window Focused
data.body:
I was thinking that the atom window need some indication when it doesn't have focus. When I'm working, and meta-tab to finder, it may look like the editor still has focus, but it doesn't. 

My first thought was to see if webkit has something like a bubbling up :focus property. Alas I can't tell if it does, looks like no.

So I think that the app should add a `.is-focused` class to `body`. so that I can engineer some color changes to indicate the editor is not focused.

data.title: Focus editor when selecting tab
data.body: Fixes github/atom#165

data.title: Glitch with cursor/newline position in files with long lines
data.body:
So I had an SVG file open and noticed a couple of really weird things going on.

Firstly, without any soft-wrap on, the newline seems to be being placed on a separate line to everything before it. This means that using the up and down arrows to navigate lines makes the highlighted line get out-of-sync with the line numbers on the left:

![atom-glitch-svg-1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/93703/2375cb52-6631-11e2-897b-750dc1eab76f.gif)

Secondly, in this situation, turning on soft-wrap makes things just… get weird. I’m not sure quite how to describe it, but the newline glitch (above gif) combined with the false newlines from the wrapping just means that cursor position, highlighted line, and actual vs. wrap line stuff all gets a little mixed up.

![atom-glitch-svg-2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/93786/db1b18a4-6634-11e2-9692-4f119410dfbf.gif)

The file in these examples is here, in case it helps in reproducing this:
https://github.com/github/octicons/blob/update-icon-files/source/add-comment.svg

data.title: Clicking a tab should focus the tabs' editor/buffer
data.body: Currently if you click a tab in another split it does not focus the editor view for the tab. I'm not sure if this is on purpose or not, but I would expect atom to put focus into the editor after clicking a tab.

data.title: Integrate node API into CEF-shell
data.body:
Hi all, I'll integrate node API into the CEF-shell used by Atom, so that you can use code like `var content = require('fs').readFileSync('/etc/passwd')` without writing extra native C++ bindings.

This will be implemented by hacking the Chromium code used by CEF, hacks including:
- Replace the message loop.
- Modify node to be friendly for embedding.
- Link CEF to node.
- Inject node symbols into DOM.

Patches will come from node-webkit's source code, and I will try to reuse [zcbenz/chromium](https://github.com/zcbenz/chromium), [zcbenz/node](https://github.com/zcbenz/node) and [rogerwang/node-webkit](https://github.com/rogerwang/node-webkit).

Since everything will be done on the Chromium side (CEF's code will be kept untouched), and Atom is using a prebuilt CEF library, the node API will come for free, and there will be very few changes to Atom's existing code.
## The Downside

Because I will fork Chromium and node, I have to update my forked Chromium everytime CEF is updated, and also update my forked node when it gets a new release. I had been doing this for 5 months when I was developing node-webkit, so this is no big problem.

Another thing is that because I will use a forked Chromium instead of the official one, the way you update the CEF shipped with Atom will change. I will update the `script/update-cef`.
## Questions

There are at least two repositories needed to be maintained, the forked chromium and the forked node. Should we host them under github.com/github?

And I think many people would be interested in a CEF that integrated with node API, should we make it public after it becomes stable?

data.title: indent region
Add Sparkle Support
data.body:
Atom binaries can be automatically updated (via Speakeasy)!

Currently we download updates in the background and install on quit. You have no choice in the matter. We plan on displaying an indicator if an update is pending, for now we don't.

data.title: No more gutter highlight for selected lines
data.body:
The line numbers in the gutter used to be a different color for lines that were selected.

This appears to have gone away, not sure if it was intentional or not.

I liked having the distinction of colors for selected/unselected lines.

/cc @jonrohan

data.title: Hide hidden files from treeView
data.body: I hate accidentally clicking on `.DS_Store`

data.title: Prepare native bindings for injection into web worker contexts
data.body:
## WIP

We currently use the `CefRegisterExtension` API to inject our native code into the window context. Unfortunately, this doesn't work with WebWorkers contexts. This PR is for converting all the native code over to use window bindings instead.

data.title: Curve tabs
data.body:
I tried very hard to make them swank like Sublime.

I was also a bit disappointed, it seems that the fake-webkit-wrapper doesn't allow for dragging of tabs. After adding `draggable=true` I couldn't get the tabs to rearrange. Any ideas?

When we truly get theme support we'll also need to consider matching colors of tabs with the overall theme of the editor.

data.title: Rename outline view to symbols view
Packages 2.0
Bring back position:fixed for tree view resizer
data.body:
Without position fixed, the resizer breaks when the tree view is scrolled.

Also needed to add https://github.com/github/atom/pull/new/restore-fixed-position-for-resizer#L0L39 to make sure the resizer was in the right place when the window was restored. If that's not the right way to do this, teach me.

data.title: Verify file exists before jumping to symbol
atom "reload?" loop
data.body: Somehow ended up with a "Are you sure you want to reload?" loop. Clicking both "cancel" and "reload" just produced another version of the same popup.

data.title: Strange behavior in ruby buffers related to end and __END__
data.body:
in the gif below, I'm writing a method and hitting tab as the next keystroke after typing "end".   the `end` immediately transforms into `__END__` and the dev tools pop. How bizarre. I feel like occasionally I hit a few more keystrokes before the dev tools appear, but usually happens immediately.

![weird end thing](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1476/82208/575c7e02-6393-11e2-9062-8034fa40f219.gif)

data.title: Having undo buffer outside of window session.
data.body: Sometimes I'll `command-R` the editor, then I realize I loose all my `command-Z` powers. It would be excellent if we serialized the undo buffer so that when the editor is reloaded, I don't loose my undo.

data.title: Indicate "searching" state in places like "Find across whole project"
data.body:
When you pull up the command palette to do a search through the whole project (i.e. `cmd+shift+f` or by entering `:Xx/…` manually), there is no visual indication that once you’ve pressed enter it’s actually doing anything. I’m not sure how best to solve this visually—but my initial gut feeling would be to try maybe having the results pane show up, but to have it contain a message like "searching now...".

It may also be worth allowing people to cancel/abort a project-wide search, because they may have inadvertently done global find instead of "find in this file" (or maybe they meant to use the fuzzy file finder instead) or something.

Thoughts?

data.title: Move All the current stylesheet into "Atom - Dark"
data.body:
I really wanted to move the stylesheets out of `src/` and into it's own theme. "Atom - Dark"

The reason being, having the style easily findable will facilitate users creating their own theme more quickly.
- [x] Fix specs (that this branch broke)
- [x] Create Atom - Light

@Caged @nathansobo @probablycorey @kevinsawicki

data.title: Add "save as" keybinding
data.body:
On OS X I generally expect in a document editor that command-shift-S gives me a "Save As" dialog; I couldn't find an existing binding that would let you save the contents of a buffer with an existing path under a new path.

The cmd-shift-S keybinding was already set to `window:save-all`, so please reject this pull if you want to keep it that way. It was just a little surprising to me as a mostly-Mac user.

data.title: Snippets reads all files in /snippets
data.body:
This is especially bad when it's a hidden file like .DS_Store

It should probably just read in non-hidden files that have a specific extension.

data.title: Bind Cmd-= to autoindent currently selected rows
Fuzzy find files using content under cursor
data.body:
Vim has a nice feature where you can try to find matching tags under the current cursor (`ctrl-]`) or try to find something filename-like under the cursor, then open that file (`gf`).

I wanted to do something for Atom during my hack day time and thought it might be interesting to add a "fuzzy find things under my cursor" command, defaulting to looking for files. If there's a single match, the file just opens, and if there are multiple matches, you get an open fuzzy finder with the text under your cursor pre-populated.

data.title: Atom's duplicating indented lines.
data.body:
I had a line over 80 characters, I added a newline and realigned the code. 
I then changed another parameter and the line (the one I originally added the newline to) is again over 80 characters. I added another newline but this time atom duplicated the line below it! 

![atom-line-dupe](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/7492/76739/8ed54b40-60fd-11e2-8ede-8c445498c601.gif)
